s.text: The LAT lead editorial, "Bill Gates is Wrong," takes exception to Gates' Coke/Pepsi analogy by saying, "Microsoft's ambition to have Windows play an integral role in virtually every American lifestyle is more like Coke telling Americans that from now on it will be their beverage, main course and dessert."
Mirroring earlier reporting, the NYT says relations between the students and troops appear friendly.
Gingrich also tells the paper that President Clinton should not embark on a planned trip to China until he answers to Congress.
Emergency room doctors and nurses were notified of the situation by a police officer, but citing hospital policy, they refused to leave the emergency room to come to his aid--thirty-five feet away.

In any case, warns the LAT , if Microsoft doesn't compromise, it could find itself being broken up by the Justice Department into "Baby Bills."
